scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes SAMM in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
The purpose of SAMM is not related to the publication of public data as open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification. 

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/

SAMM documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
OWASP is an open community dedicated to enabling organizations to conceive, develop, acquire, operate, and maintain applications that can be trusted. All of the OWASP tools, documents, forums, and chapters are free and open to anyone interested in improving application security. 

Moreover, the community has established different ways to contribute to the development of tools and documents.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/

SAMM documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf 

Contribute page: 
https://owaspsamm.org/contributing/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
OWASP defines and evolves specifications on a community-driven basis, where all the stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification.

The assets of the specifications are publically available on Github and all users can create issues or add modifications.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/

SAMM documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf 

Contribute page: 
https://owaspsamm.org/contributing/

criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
SAMM is licensed under CC, which essentially means that the commercial use of the work and possible derivative works is allowed, the distribution of which must be done with a license equal to the one that regulates the original work.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/

SAMM documentation:

criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The first version of the specification was released back in 2009 and has been maintained and evolved on a community-driven basis until achieving version 2.0 released in 2020. The evolution of the specification involves a wide range of technical profiles and experience in the field of this specification. Through continuous improvement and discussion the specification has been released late in 2020 but with a cured development ensuring the maturity of the specification.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/

SAMM documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
Even though the version assessed is a very recent version of the specification, it has a strong community supporting it with a clear process of development that has been working towards the maximisation of quality and usefulness. So it can be used in the development of products and services. 

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/

SAMM documentation:

criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
SAMM provides an effective and measurable way for all types of organizations to analyze and improve their software security posture. Applying the model, the organisation can develop and improve software applications in terms of security. Therefore, the specification can be used within the creation and maintenance of innovative solutions since security is a key aspect.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/

SAMM documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
SAMM is not included in European or National platforms, however, openness and the benefits for the creation of public and reusable solutions is the philosophy of the specification. Besides, it is fully accessible for its consultation, study, implementation or contribution to its development. 

Additionally, ENISA and ETSI which are European agencies for the development of security and standards recommend the specification as a best practices in terms of security in software development. 

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/ 

ETSI SmartM2M; Security; Standards Landscape and best practices:  
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_tr/103500_103599/103533/01.01.01_60/tr_103533v010101p.pdf 

ENISA Advancing Software Security in the EU: 
https://www.enisa.europa.eu/publications/advancing-software-security-through-the-eu-certification-framework

ENISA Good Practices for Security of IoT - Secure Software Development Lifecycle: 
https://www.enisa.europa.eu/publications/good-practices-for-security-of-iot-1

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
SAMM is a set of criteria that supports all types of organizations in developing and improving software solutions. It supports the complete software lifecycle and is technology and process agnostic, allowing its maximum reuse.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/ 

SAMM documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
SAMM was defined with flexibility in mind so that small, medium, and large organizations using any style of development can customize and adopt it. It provides a means of knowing where your organization is on its journey towards software assurance and understanding what is recommended to move to the next level of maturity. So it can be said that SAMM can be applied and developed in different domains and purposes without harming the interoperability of functionality of systems.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/ 

SAMM documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
SAMM aims to help organizations analyse their current software security practices. By following and implementing SAMM European Institutions can improve and develop software that allows data portability ensuring maximum security on these information transactions.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/ 

SAMM Documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The scalability and broad character of the specification can make possible the creation and the availability of solutions fostering the reuse and availability of information between administrations and citizens. This fact demonstrates that the specification can foster the implementation of the once-only principle while ensuring the security and trustworthy data exchanges. 

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org/ 

SAMM Documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
SAMM’s purpose is focused to help and improve security capabilities within organisations and software development. Therefore, it can be said that by applying SAMM public administrations can work towards ensuring secure and trustworthy data exchange with all stakeholders.

SAMM documentation:

criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The self-assessment model allows users to manage the development and deployment of software and adapt the actions to each specific purpose targeting depending on the organisation's needs. This fact helps public administrations to create and implement secure digital public services without wasting time and means. 

Moreover, the creation of secure digital public services fosters the eGovernment and the digitalisation reducing administrative burden.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org

SAMM documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
SAMM includes recommendations on data protection and requirements for the proper protection and management of relevant data over their lifetime and also over time. More specifically, it is written down under the operational management and the first stream, which states the outcomes and need of establishing a data catalogue.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org

SAMM Documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

https://owaspsamm.org

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
At the time of elaborating this assessment, this specification is not included in any EIRA ABB in the last version of the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). However, it has been associated to "Security Framework" of the Organisational view for the on-going version that is going to be published in May 2021. 

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/solution/elis

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications v1.0.1 (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/solution/elis/release/v101-0

statement: After searching for a certification or conformity test to validate this document, no tool has been found that assesses the conformity of the specification.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
After searching in the different official European websites, agencies such as ENISA or ETSI are recommending SAMSS as one of the reference frameworks for the development of secure software solutions. 

ETSI SmartM2M; Security; Standards Landscape and best practices:  
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_tr/103500_103599/103533/01.01.01_60/tr_103533v010101p.pdf 

ENISA Advancing Software Security in the EU: 
https://www.enisa.europa.eu/publications/advancing-software-security-through-the-eu-certification-framework

ENISA Good Practices for Security of IoT - Secure Software Development Lifecycle: 
https://www.enisa.europa.eu/publications/good-practices-for-security-of-iot-1

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
SAMM is not included in any Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
ETSI and ENISA are recommending it within documents about guidelines and best practices for securing solutions and services. 

ETSI SmartM2M; Security; Standards Landscape and best practices:  
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_tr/103500_103599/103533/01.01.01_60/tr_103533v010101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
ETSI and ENISA are recommending its use for the development of software. It is a key aspect to consider that the specification is being considered and recognised for the development of public services.

ETSI SmartM2M; Security; Standards Landscape and best practices:  
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_tr/103500_103599/103533/01.01.01_60/tr_103533v010101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
ETSI is recommending it within a technical report that provides the standards landscape and best practices on security aspects. Therefore, since the European Telecommunications Standards Institute is recommending its use it can be considered compliant with the European Law of standardisation. 

ETSI SmartM2M; Security; Standards Landscape and best practices:  
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_tr/103500_103599/103533/01.01.01_60/tr_103533v010101p.pdf 

ENISA Advancing Software Security in the EU: 
https://www.enisa.europa.eu/publications/advancing-software-security-through-the-eu-certification-framework

https://www.enisa.europa.eu/publications/good-practices-for-security-of-iot-1

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of SAMM is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org

SAMM documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
SAMM is a commonly used method for assessing and improving security aspects. It can be considered as a security framework that needs to be followed according to organisations needs to provide compliant and services and data that can be reused across border and institutions without hampering its usefulness and security features.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org 

SAMM Documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
The purpose of SAMM is not related to the definition of a resusable data model. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

SAMM webpage:
https://owaspsamm.org

SAMM documentation: 
https://github.com/OWASP/samm/blob/master/Supporting%20Resources/v2.0/OWASP-SAMM-v2.0.pdf
